summary: I am frequently asked to blurb upcoming books and I do try to read and (when appropriate) offer up those endorsements. title: On Blurb Hiatus Through the End of 2024

summary: Why yes, I was an avid music fan during the peak of Rule Britannia.  I had1 the mandatory copies of Different Class, I Should Coco, and The Great Escape.  I was there for Jarvis' arse-waggle at a pompous Michael Jackson, there for "the Battle of Britpop"2, there for the hidden booklet in Kid A that tore into Mister Tony Blair...
title: My hot take nostalgia piece on the news that Oasis are reforming

summary:
This is a big deal.  A US Appeals Court ruled that geofence warrants—these are general warrants demanding information about all people within a geographical boundary—are unconstitutional. 
The decision seems obvious to me, but you can’t take anything for granted...
title: US Federal Court Rules Against Geofence Warrants
